elements.title: AI Designs Quantum Physics Experiments Beyond What Any Human Has Conceived
elements.contents:

Discover the best of the web

Today’s essential reads

AI Designs Quantum Physics Experiments Beyond What Any Human Has Conceived

Scientific American · 9 min

Quantum physicist Mario Krenn remembers sitting in a café in Vienna in early 2016, poring over computer printouts, trying to make sense of what MELVIN had found. MELVIN was a machine-learning algorithm Krenn had built, a kind of artificial intelligence.

Some People Flip Real Estate. I Flip Men.

The New York Times · 7 min

Condo Buildings Are at Risk. So Is All Real Estate.

The Atlantic · 7 min

Summer of Soul Is an Electrifying Rebuttal to the Worship of Woodstock

Slate · 6 min

How TikTok's 'Glitch Queen' created the app's hottest dance of the summer with no prior dance training

insider.com · 3 min

Fascinating stories

Robots were supposed to take our jobs. Instead, they’re making them worse.

Vox · 16 min

The robot apocalypse is already here, it just looks different than you thought.

Hospitals Have Started Posting Their Prices Online. Here's What They Reveal

NPR · 8 min

Long hidden, such price variations are supposed to be available in stark black and white under a Trump administration price transparency rule that took effect at the start of this year.

Why I’m glad that I’m an ‘overthinker’

The Guardian · 7 min

The first time I remember someone telling me not to overthink was when I was trying to suss out breastfeeding. “Don’t overthink it,” said my friend, “just go with it.” “Just going with it” is not something I do.

By Now, Burnout Is a Given

The Atlantic · 5 min

The pandemic has stripped our emotional reserves even further, laying bare our unique physical, social, and emotional vulnerabilities.

How to Raise a Confident Child

Lifehacker · 3 min

Confidence doesn't come naturally to every kid—but parents can help them build those muscles.

A Disparaging Video Prompts Explosive Fallout Within ESPN

The New York Times · 13 min

In comments still rippling through the network, the reporter Rachel Nichols, who is white, said Maria Taylor, who is Black, earned the job to host 2020 N.B.A. finals coverage because ESPN was “feeling pressure” on diversity.

Where’s My Lyme Vaccine?

Slate · 8 min

‘They said I don’t exist. But I am here’ – one woman’s battle to prove she isn’t dead

The Guardian · 17 min

What Made Early Humans Smart

Nautilus · 15 min

Crows Are Self-Aware and 'Know What They Know,' Just Like Humans

Popular Mechanics · 3 min
Save these stories in a personal library

Use the button to build your personal library of articles right in Pocket. Read them when you’re free in a quiet, calm space.

Start your library

Inside the Tumultuous Years Before the Florida Condo Collapse

The New York Times · 12 min

The condo board knew that Champlain Towers South in Surfside, Fla., needed major repairs. It did not know the complex was in a race against time.

What If Regulating Facebook Fails?

WIRED · 10 min

It seems increasingly likely that antitrust and content moderation tools aren’t up to the task. Here’s what we do next.

Keep parents out of it: the expert who wants schools to give up weekly spelling tests

The Guardian · 4 min

Sending home lists of words to learn with stressed-out parents does not help children, says literacy guru Jane Considine.

Six Verbs That Make You Sound Weak (No Matter Your Job Title)

Fast Company · 4 min

Sometimes it’s the smallest words and phrases that shape how you’re perceived around the office. Here are a few to watch out for at every level.

They Didn’t Expect to Retire Early. The Pandemic Changed Their Plans.

The New York Times · 6 min

After years in which Americans worked later in life, the latest economic disruption has driven many out of the work force prematurely. Dee Dee Patten, 57, hadn’t planned to retire early.
